item.title: The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1
item.description:
The Untold Story of Silk Road, Part 1

How a 29-year-old idealist built a global drug bazaar and became a murderous kingpin.

item.title: Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius
item.description:
Karl Ove Knausgård: In America, an Alcoholic-In Scandinavia, Just a Genius

Karl Ove Knausgård, a Norwegian now domiciled with his wife and four kids in Sweden, is perhaps the world's most revered living writer. Only, if he were American, the principal thing he and everyone else would say about him is that he is an alcoholic.

item.title: Jasper Wong: Championing expression in a corporate climate
item.description:
Jasper Wong: Championing expression in a corporate climate

As part of last week's SXSW festival, Jasper Wong was among a collective of graffiti artists to transform the bare walls of downtown Austin into colourful tapestries. HUCK tracked him down to source his greatest creative inspirations.

item.title: How Big Pharma Is Cashing in on Addiction to Alcohol and Illicit Drugs
item.description:
How Big Pharma Is Cashing in on Addiction to Alcohol and Illicit Drugs

Addiction treatment has become big business. If you haven't noticed it yet, investors certainly have. The U.S. Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration projected the market for addiction treatment at about $35 billion for 2014. Since 2006, private equity firms have invested more than $2.2 billion in substance abuse treatment companies.

item.title: Action Bronson Hits a High-Tech Dab Lab (F*CK, THAT'S DELICIOUS Deleted Scene)
item.description:
Action Bronson Hits a High-Tech Dab Lab (F*CK, THAT'S DELICIOUS Deleted Scene)

Action Bronson visits a high-tech dabs lab in this deleted scene from F*CK, THAT'S DELICIOUS on VICELAND.

item.title: This Supermassive Black Hole Blasts 125 Million Miles-Per-Hour Winds
item.description:
This Supermassive Black Hole Blasts 125 Million Miles-Per-Hour Winds

At the heart of just about every galaxy, including our own Milky Way, there's a supermassive black hole-some of which are actively devouring "torn-apart stars, dust, rocks, planets, and anything that gets too close," Jesse Rogerson, a PhD candidate at York University in Toronto, told me.

item.title: A neural pathway that erases memories
item.description:
A neural pathway that erases memories

In order to remember, we must forget. Recent research shows that when your brain retrieves newly encoded information, it suppresses older related information so that it does not interfere with the process of recall. Now a team of European researchers has identified a neural pathway that induces forgetting by actively erasing memories.

item.title: Mitski - Your Best American Girl
item.description:
Mitski - Your Best American Girl

"Your Best American Girl" off of 'Puberty 2' by Mitski, out June 17th, 2016 on Dead Oceans Dead Oceans: http://smarturl.it/mitski iTunes: http://smarturl.it/mitski_it Amazon: http://smarturl.it/mitski_amz Support your local independent record store: http://smarturl.it/mitski_ind

item.title: 5 Groups Who Love Their 'Uppers,' AKA Speed, and You Might Be Surprised by Who They Are
item.description:
5 Groups Who Love Their 'Uppers,' AKA Speed, and You Might Be Surprised by Who They Are

The popular image of the toothless tweaker living in a trailer park in Oklahoma or Indiana obscures a much broader history of amphetamine use, encompassing remarkably diverse populations of speed users around the world and through the decades. What seems to tie them all together is their resort to the stimulant to increase productivity and performance, whether for work or pleasure.

item.title: Social experiment shows hundreds ignoring 'homeless boy' in New Zealand
item.description:
Social experiment shows hundreds ignoring 'homeless boy' in New Zealand

A social experiment by New Zealand police has filmed hundreds of people ignoring a homeless boy digging through a rubbish bin in Auckland for food. The "hungry boy" video is part of a recruitment campaign by the New Zealand police, and poses the question "Do you care enough to be a cop?"
